page.title: 14ST.JOHN'S CHURCHWASHINGBORO.
page.content: THE CHURCH IS CALLED ' THE CHURCH OF SAINT JOHN THE EVANGELIST'DATES BACK TO NORMAN TIMES.IT IS BUILT MAINLY OF STONE,IT HAS A TOWER WITH 8 PINNACLES CONTAINING A CLOCK AND 8 BELLS.THE CHURH ALSO HAS A BRASS CHANDELIER WHICH USED TO BELONG TO KING GEORGE 1V. MR PETER EURE WHO WAS LORD OF THE MANOR GAVE MONEY TO THE CHURCH AND MR TIMOTHY PIKE GAVE SONE BELLS IN 1713. THESE TWO BOTH LEFT MONEY TO START AN EDUCATIONAL CHARITY FOR FURTHER EDUCATIONIN THE VILLAGE.THE CHURCH WAS BUILT IN THE LATE 11th.CENTURY,IT WAS RESTORED IN 1869 AT THE EXPENSE OF THE LATE REV.SIBTHORP.THE SAME MR PIKE AND MR EURE PAID FOR THE FIRST SCHOOL IN WASHINGBOROUGH WHICH OPENED IN 1727 AND COMBINED WITH OUR SCHOOL WHEN IT OPENED. WE HAVE A LOT TO THANK THESE TWO MEN FOR OR HAVE WE!!
